chapter.title: Running and debugging ANTLR applications
chapter.subtitle: How to run and debug your ANTLR application

sect2.title: Common commandline options
sect2.para: All ANTLR applications support a number of standard commandline options. These are removed from argv by antlr_init().

formalpara.para: Make ANTLR abort on all warnings. This is useful to stop on the first warning in a debugger, if your application is printing multiple warnings. It's almost always best to start debugging with the first warning that occurs.
A list of debug options to turn on in addition to those specified in the ANTLR_DEBUG environment variable. This option is only available if ANTLR has been configured with --enable-debug=yes.
A list of debug options to turn off. This option is only available if ANTLR has been configured with --enable-debug=yes.

sect2.title: Environment variables
sect2.para: ANTLR inspects a number of environment variables in addition to standard variables like LANG, PATH or HOME; mostly to determine paths to look for certain files.

formalpara.para:
If ANTLR has been configured with --enable-debug=yes, this variable can be set to a list of debug options, which cause ANTLR to print out different types of debugging information.
decisions
Cross-process embedding
retry
Text widget internals
dfa
Tree widget internals
The special value all can be used to turn on all debug options.

A list of modules to load.
lipsy
Export sentence to Lypsi format
railroad
Export grammar to Railroad format
The special value all can be used to turn on all module options.
